column4: I want to install Ubuntu to my old computer, because that computer is unusable now from the lot of viruses.       Config: 1 GB RAM, 5 GB free space, very slow videocard. I dont want to store my work there. Guys please help me in the choice! Which would better for that computer, Ubuntu or Xubuntu?
VozniakBR, Indoctrine: Thanks. I will try
what cpu does it have? a slow video card doesn't really make it necessary to use xubuntu
if it has 1 GB of ram, it will probably run ubuntu quite well
I worry about the winchester. Its very very slow.
I'm sorry, I didn't understand what you mean by that
I would doubt that it matters that much. five years is fairly old though
I would almost recommend ubuntu, although I don't have much experience with slower machines.
I don't think you'd lose much even if you did use xubuntu instead of ubuntu
you can always make it into an ubuntu if you like
you can install the same programs in xubuntu as you can in ubuntu
yes, they have the same repositories. the only difference is what comes on the cd
